events.name: Singapore Science Festival: Visual SG: Beauty in Patterns
events.description:
South East Asia’s signature Visualisation Festival, Visual SG, presents a full on visual spectacle of data through the lens of artistic and creative expression. With a line-up of interactive displays, forums and workshops, a highlight includes unwrapping and exploring an Egyptian mummy using an interactive touch table.
 Entry: Admission fees to Science Centre Singapore apply
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road, Singapore 609081

events.name: A*PECSS Tech Talk Lab to Market: Stem Cell Technology
events.description:
Program Outline:

We would like to invite you to participate in A*PECSS tech talk series: Lab to Market: Thematic Conversations Between ECRs with SMEs and Startups. 
Here is a brief summary of the event:  
Purpose of Lab to Market:
The purpose of the tech talk series would be to bring more awareness to SMEs and startups regarding latest technological advances and product development within A*STAR. This will also provide a networking platform for SMEs and startups to strike up conversations or initiate collaborations with A*STAR early career researchers (ECRs), and a perspective of the local market needs and economy directions for A*STAR ECRs.  
Coming up in July, Stem Cell Technology is the main theme and a group of speakers comprising commercialisation expert, scientist and local industry representative will be giving concise and interesting presentations on that day.
Date & Time: July 28th Thursday 5.30-7.00pm
Venue: A*START Central, Blk 79, Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-01, JTC Launchpad (Opp Fusionopolis), Singapore 139955
Schedule 
5.30-5.45pm
Talk Title: Stem Cell Technlogies
Dr. Rahul Gopalkrishnan (Vice President of Biotechnology Commercialization Cluster, ETPL, A*STAR)




Dr. Gopalkrishnan is responsible for diverse life sciences and biotechnology, patenting and licensing projects, based on technologies developed in the A*STAR Research Institutes. 
His career path started off with lab research which led into patenting his biotech research inventions. This was followed by immersion in patent law, in a law firm and his present focus on industry engagement and technology transfer. 




5.45-6.00pm
Talk Title: Modeling Diabetes using Stem Cell Derived Pancreatic Beta Cells
Dr. Jamie Trott (Research Fellow, IMB, A*STAR)


Dr. Jamie Trott is currently a research fellow in the lab of Dr Ray Dunn at the Institute of Medical Biology (IMB), A*STAR, Singapore. The Insulin-secreting beta cells of the pancreas are responsible for maintaining normal blood glucose levels, and their failure leads to diabetes.
Dr. Trott is currently developing in vitro differentiation protocols for generating functional beta cells from human pluripotent stem cells. Such protocols will enable the generation of sufficient beta cells for transplantation into diabetic patients whose own beta cells are no longer functional. Furthermore, the ability to generate patient-specific beta cells in vitro will facilitate crucial studies into how and why beta cells fail in diabetes. To this end Dr. Trott is currently generating beta cells from a number of diabetic patients to identify genetic and physiological defects leading to beta cell failure. Prior to joining A*STAR, Dr. Trott obtained his PhD in stem cell biology in the lab of Prof Alfonso Martinez-Arias (Cambridge University) and studied biochemistry at Imperial College London. 
6.00-6.15pm
Talk Title: Scientists Helping Scientist
Ms. Jacqueline Ng (Regional Sales Manager, STEMCELL Technologies Inc.)


Ms. Jacqueline Ng is a Regional Sales Manager with STEMCELL Technologies Inc. She has been with the company since 2009 and oversees a team of technical sales representatives and distributors in South East Asia. She also scouts for innovative technologies in Singapore and has facilitated over ten scientific collaborations between local researchers and STEMCELL’s scientists. Prior to joining STEMCELL, Jacqueline reviewed primary healthcare policies at the Ministry of Health (Singapore). Jacqueline obtained her honours degree in Science from the University of Melbourne, Australia. 
6.15pm onwards
Networking session with refreshments and wine
events.location: A*START Central, #05-01, JTC Launchpad, Blk 79, Ayer Rajah Crescent, Opp Fusionopolis, Singapore 139955

events.name: Monthly Meetup - Breakdown of Hot Potato and Local Privilege Escalation
events.description: Agenda :  Introduction & Networking Singapore's Infosec Community and How you can be Involved by Emil Tan Breakdown of Hot Potato - Windows Privilege Escalation by Sunny Neo Local Privilege Escalation – From Hero to UID 0 by Paul Craig Abstract: Breakdown of Hot Potato - Windows Privilege Escalation Hot Potato is a tool released by Stephen Breen from FoxGlove Security that enables low privilege user to escalate privilege to SYSTEM from Windows 7 onwards. This talk aims to provide a breakdown of how several old Windows vulnerabilities can be chained together to escalate privilege, and bring awareness to the danger of default configurations Local Privilege Escalation – From Hero to UID 0. Although “getting shell” is often the goal of any seasoned hacker, in reality that shell will have low privileges, with limited access to the local host or the real treasures it may hold. To truly become a master of your domain you must be able to become UID 0 or NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM through a technique known as local privilege escalation. This presentation will delve into the many methods of privilege escalation that exist in both Windows and Unix Systems and show just how easy it is go from hero to UID 0. Speaker Bio: Sunny Neo is a Penetration Tester at BT Security. He started his information security since he was 15 by manually removing the Blaster worm with instructions on Symantec website. He dabbled with malware removal and behaviour analysis for a while before starting his formal education on Cyber Security. Since then, he has graduated with a Master’s Degree (Computer Science: Information Security) from Georgia Institute of Technology, and holds several certifications such as CREST Certified Web Application Tester (CCT APP), CREST Registered Penetration Tester (CRT), GXPN, OSCE, and OSCP. Paul Craig leads the offensive security "PT" team at Vantage Point, here in Sunny Singapore. Paul originally hails from New Zealand and is an avid hacker with a passion for the dark art of exploitation. Paul has been hacking professionally for the past 13 years and considers nothing impossible. See you all there, Null SG core team.
events.location: EY #19-02 Training Room, The Arcade, 11 Collyer Quay, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - July 2016 Meetup
events.description: Dear All, Its meetup time again at Singapore SQL PASS Chapter.  Please refer below for the details. Agenda: July 28th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Dharmendra Keshari 8:00 PM to 8:15 - Break 8:15 PM to 9:30 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Nagaraj Venkatesan Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Conf Room SINOMB 22CF-15 Topic 1: SQL Server - Extended Events – Part2 Synopsis: Extended events aids in performance tuning and in day to day administration especially when you don't have any benchmarking data for troubleshooting issues. In this session, we will see extended event architecture, an event life cycle, how we can use default extended events session to analyze the health of SQL Server on periodically. Besides these, the presentation would also cover advance level troubleshooting like query compilation, Tempdb contention issue are many more… Speaker Profile: Dharmendra Keshari Dharmendra Keshari has strong and in-depth experience in Database Management and its internals. Currently, working as Senior Database Administrator in one of the best organization in Singapore. He is an avid, regular mentor on social media, helping several enthusiast in solving problems related to Database management. He has completed certification for “Microsoft SQL Server® 2008, Implementation” and “Maintenance & Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Database” Topic 2:  Cardinality Estimator - Before 2014 and After Synopsis: Cardinality estimator providing row estimates, plays a pivotal role in obtaining efficient query plans. Cardinality Estimator algorithm which remained unchanged since SQL 7.0, was revamped in SQL Server 2014. The presentation will take a ride through the new cardinality estimator, showcase the need for the significant redesign and demonstrate the new cardinality estimator's efficiency at different scenarios. Presentation will also cover how one can perform regressive testing, checking for any performance degradation on new cardinality estimator and how they can be handled gracefully. Speaker Profile: Nagaraj Venkatesan Nagaraj Venkatesan, a SQL Server enthusiast exploring SQL Server for the last 10 years. Working for NCS Pte Ltd as SQL Server DBA, Nagaraj maintains databases used by one of the busiest public facing applications in the city. He frequently blogs at strictlysql.blogspot.com and is a regular contributor sqlservercentral.com. Besides these, he also holds a Masters Degree in Computing from National University of Singapore
events.location: Microsoft Operations Pte Ltd, 22CF15, Level 22, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: Introduction to the Quantopian Platform with Anthony Ng
events.description: Join us for our free hands on meetup led by Anthony Ng! Anthony will be giving an introduction to the Quantopian platform and the IDE (interactive development environment). He will also discuss how to conduct backtests and will preview some examples. Afterwards, guests will have a chance to run their their own backtests or find more ideas in the community forums to try out. We hope you can join us!   Agenda  6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking 7:00pm - 7:50pm Presentation: Introduction to the Quantopian platform and the backtester  8:00pm - 8:50pm Hands on: Hunting for ideas in the community forum Lecturer Anthony Ng has been teaching investment and portfolio management related modules at educational institutions since 2010. He holds an MBA and an MFE from Otago University (NZ) and NUS (Singapore) respectively. With a strong passion for finance, data science, and programming, Anthony has also designed curriculums for his own beginner level algorithmic trading workshops in addition to Quantopian events.

events.name: Using Robot Framework to test backend services
events.description:
Let's come together to learn about testing backend complexities, using Robot Framework from Ika Belerma from ThoughtWorks Singapore. Experience the way in which Ika has solved testing problems using the framework. This will be a talk and a demo including working code and interactive Q&A. Post the Robot session, we plan to have a round of open space amongst the community members. In this we can raise topics and share our learnings. 


Agenda: 6.45 pm - 7.15 pm ==== Snacks & networking! 7.15 pm - 8.00pm ==== Session on Robot Framework 8.00pm - 9.00pm==== Open space (how it works : click here)

events.name: ArtScience Late x The Observatory- Pagan Thoughts
events.description:
ArtScience Late x The Observatory – Pagan Thoughts
Thursday, 28 July, 8pm
***Entry is free, on a strict first come first served basis***

"Re-assemble the atoms of our Zomian minds so we can climb out ..."

ArtScience Museum welcomes Singapore’s legendary experimental art rock band, The Observatory to the museum for the first time.  

Since their formation in 2001, The Observatory has gone from folk electronica to prog to avant rock, taking a stylistic sledgehammer to each and every one of their previous releases, and approaching a more primal sound in recent years. Texturally complex and visceral, The Observatory’s music crosses wasted borders to parallel polarities within human existence, provoking and inspiring in a deeply enigmatic way.

 In this special edition of ArtScience Late, The Observatory presents an installation-performance that draws attention to the aspirations and desires of some of our own island-city folke with recorded interviews, premeditated frequencies and music. Taking inspiration from the theme behind their album Oscilla; The Observatory delves into the desire to live off-grid as a reaction to today's consumerist society. Despite modern-day difficulties, a growing number of people across the civilised world have elected to pursue and embrace a lifestyle motivated by ethics.  Given the unrelenting pressures of contemporary life and the scale of environmental devastation, it is no wonder the yearning to escape will only get stronger.
